alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Caldwell; Fayette; Gonzales; Lavaca; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 03 at 10:14PM CDT until June 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALDWELL...BASTROP...NORTHEASTERN GONZALES...SOUTH CENTRAL LEE...FAYETTE AND NORTHWESTERN LAVACA COUNTIES... At 1013 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Paige to near Cistern to near Waelder, moving southeast at 20 mph. The severe thunderstorm near Smithville has been absorbed by the line of thunderstorms. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bastrop, La Grange, Smithville, Schulenburg, Flatonia, Moulton, Waelder, Fayetteville, Camp Swift, Circle D-KC Estates, Rosanky, Muldoon, Cistern, Wyldwood, Upton, Komensky, Swiss Alp, Henkhaus, Hills Prairie and Rutersville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bastrop; Caldwell; Fayette; Gonzales; Lavaca; Lee
